title: Why is 17 multiplied by 3 equal 51 and not 42…since when multiplying the smaller number which is the remainder is left and carried over? - Quora

response.answer_text: There are many ways people may use to multiply numbers, but using a flawed process will give you flawed results. Multiplying 17 by 3 is the same as adding 17+17+17, or 17, 3 times. There is no dispute that this equals 51. what your are proposing is a flawed process. If you are going to multiply the “ones place” (7) by 3, then you need to multiply the “tens place” (1) by 3 as well. 3x7 = 21 3x10 = 30 21+30 = 51

Quoran, you better go back to grade school RIGHT NOW! 3 x 17. OK. 3 x 7 is 21. Write down the 1 and carry the 2. 3 x 1 = 3, 3 + 2 = 5. Write down the 5. You now have 3 x 17: 51 Here’s another way to look at it: 17 = 10 + 7. 3 x (10 + 7) = 3x10 + 3x7 = 30 + 21 = 51.
